channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+3419] Accidental Subway Rainbow (PIC)
item.description: "I nearly lost it when I realized I was wearing orange under my sweater. No one else cared."

item.title: [+2989] Could this be the perfect HL2 Movie Casting? (PIC)
item.description: Can you think of a better cast? I wouldn't mind seeing Michelle Forbes, the voice of Judith Mossman, playing her in the movie instead of Juliana Margulies.

item.title: [+1960] The Paint-Less Coca-Cola Would Save Earth One Can at a Time
item.description: It doesn't only look beautiful, and it would make Jon Ive and Steve Jobs wet, but this naked Coca-Cola can would help save energy while reducing air and water pollution. Would it really make a difference? Let's do some math:

item.title: [+1447] How Will You Die? (GRAPHIC)
item.description: While you may be worried of catching of an obscure disease you heard about on the news, the truth is that we are far more likely to die of...

item.title: [+1286] Every Episode of 'Hell's Kitchen' Ever [FLOWCHART]
item.description: Somebody overcooked the rice. God help us all.

item.title: [+1261] Analemma over Ukraine
item.description: Explanation: If you took a picture of the Sun at the same time each day, would it remain in the same position? The answer is no, and the shape traced out by the Sun over the course of a year is called an analemma.

item.title: [+1256] Dubai Has Always Been Bankrupt -- Morally & Environmentally
item.description: The idea that Dubai is an oasis of freedom on the Arabian peninsular is one of the great lies.Yes, it has Starbucks & Gucci, but beneath these, there is a dictatorship built by slaves. The people who really built the city can be seen in long chain-gangs by the side of the road, or toiling all day at the top of the tallest buildings in the world.

item.title: [+1183] Twitter and Electronic Billboards don't mix very well
[+1085] National Animals: Mine is Bigger
[+1071] 5 Disturbing Ways the Human Body Will Evolve in the Future
item.description: We don't think of ourselves as changing: We're the same basic meat popsicles we've always been. But some of the surprising changes that the future holds in store for the human body are ball-shatteringly disturbing, so you'd better have an iron stomach if you plan on reading this (though if not, don't worry; those are probably in the pipeline too).

item.title: [+986] Pub fined $13k for Wi-Fi copyright infringement
item.description: A pub owner in the U.K. has been fined £8,000 (about $13,183) because someone unlawfully downloaded copyrighted material over its open Wi-Fi hotspot, according to the managing director of hotspot provider The Cloud.

item.title: [+895] Four Skinheads Shank Mexican, Got Pwned and Charged w/ Crime
item.description: What do you get when four skinheads stab a Mexican in Huntington Beach’s Oak View barrio? Four beat-up skinheads facing hate-crime charges

item.title: [+782] Fallen Disney Princesses [Pics]
item.description: Photographer Dina Goldstein gives us a more modern interpretation of the classic fairy tale princess.

item.title: [+746] 4 Police Shot Dead In Coffee Shop Ambush Near Seattle
item.description: Four sheriff's deputies were fatally shot Sunday in what police described as an ambush in a coffee shop near Seattle.

item.title: [+677] Robin Williams plays Call of Duty, named his daughter Zelda
item.description: While Robin Williams guested on Fallon's show this week, he asked the hairy-handed comedian about his gaming habits – some of which we've covered in the past – and found out that not only does the man play his fair share of Call of Duty, but he also named his daughter "Zelda" after ... well, the Princess Zelda.

item.title: [+636] 4th Generation iPhone Now Being Tested
item.description: References to "iPhone3,1" was first discovered in the iPhone firmware files back in August, but this seems to be the first time that it has been spotted "in the wild". Apple similarly began testing the iPhone 3GS (iPhone2,1) back in October of 2008 about 8 months ahead of its launch.

item.title: [+625] Aggressive Atheism (VIDEO)
item.description: Pat Condell talks about aggresive atheism and why he thinks religion does not deserve any respect...

item.title: [+609] HDR in photography vs. HDR in video games [Pic]
[+605] Spray-On Jesus (PHOTO)
item.description: Here's what we know: Jesus is in a can. Jesus is bleeding. There's now 20% more Jesus.Here's what we don't know: How Jesus got in the can. Whether or not Jesus appears when you spray this. Who handles Jesus's PR.

item.title: [+587] From Dollars To Death Panels: How Republicans Distorted Deba
item.description: With Thanksgiving recess now upon us, it seems an appropriate time to revisit the hysterical Republican whoppers and talking points about the Democratic party agenda that have dominated this Congress. Herewith a top-five list:
